channel.title: Episode 3 Discussion and Information.
channel.description:
Discuss and talk about the final game in the Half Life 2 series.
Talk about what you want to see, and what you hope to see. etc.
Pictures: ![](upload://9TMgDsPOnhAl9arVXsKRy0o23Fa.jpeg) ![](upload://z7u9iWPYIgCBr6sk9RwTpxVfK5r.jpeg)

item.title: Episode 3 Discussion and Information.
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
They made that texture for the shotgun soldiers to make them visibly distinct from regular soldiers. Giving that texture to all of the soldiers kinda defeats the purpose.

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Discussion and Information.
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
Dias:

I’ve wondered why they even bothered to create a texture for shotgun-wielding combine at all.

I wondered why they didn’t apply it to all the soldiers. Why just shotguns?
Personally, I think all the soldiers should wear eye-patches in EP3.

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Discussion and Information.
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
I think it was the different goggle colour that was intended to do most of the distinguishing and the rest may have been mostly aesthetic, considering the prison guards only had their goggles changed in the update.

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Discussion and Information.
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
I figured that, but while it does make them distinct from ordinary soldiers, the difference isn’t as noticeable from a distance, only up-close where it would probably already be obvious that that’s what they’re using. The rusty-colored texture does blend in more so with the outdoor environment like Omega said, somewhat defeating the purpose of making them stand out, since they’d be harder to see at a distance. The only real difference left is the color goggles glow in the dark. I just want to know the thought process behind it all.

Slunket:

Dias, do you ever stop bitching?

Not really, no. If I have a problem with something that I can’t control myself, I make it known.

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Discussion and Information.
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
Dias:

I don’t really think they blend in very well, but it’s a good point. Personally, I’ve wondered why they even bothered to create a texture for shotgun-wielding combine at all. I guess now I have even more of an incentive to send an email asking about it.

Wasn’t it just so they’d be more easily identifiable, as they’re potentially a larger threat?

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Discussion and Information.
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Dias:

Minimum what was my question. Minimum weather effects? Minimum gameplay quality? Minimum length driving section? Minimum number of snowmen? All I ask is was that you be a tad more specific

You’re overthinking it, but for the sake of an answer, I mean the graphical effects of the snow. Of course I didn’t mean gameplay, since they’re two different games.

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Discussion and Information.
item.dc:creator: Slunket
item.description:
Dias, do you ever stop bitching?

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Discussion and Information.
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
Minimum what was my question. Minimum weather effects? Minimum gameplay quality? Minimum length driving section? Minimum number of snowmen? All I ask is was that you be a tad more specific.

Omega_Absolute:

What better to blend in with tree trunks?

I don’t really think they blend in very well, but it’s a good point. Personally, I’ve wondered why they even bothered to create a texture for shotgun-wielding combine at all. I guess now I have even more of an incentive to send an email asking about it.

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Discussion and Information.
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Dias:

Minimum what? And honestly, why should anyone, let alone Valve, shoot for a minimum standard?

Have you ever seen the snowy levels of Uncharted 2? The way they’ve done the precipitation effects along with the way your walking around affects the snow, it was done really well.

If Ep 3 is actually going for snowy environments, then Valve should, at least, make the snow effects as good as the Uncharted ones.

Here is a video showing what I’m talking about:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OVhBwqOOyno

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Discussion and Information.
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
What better to blend in with tree trunks?

421×677 84.1 KB

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Discussion and Information.
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
There was going to be forest camo shotgun soldiers in older EP1 screenshots, but not in any retail game. In EP2, the shotgun soldiers use a gray & red texture.

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Discussion and Information.
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
Dias:

Not to mention the fact that Valve clearly avoid putting real camo on anything. They made the soldiers in HL1 use white camo so they’d stand out in the desert & combine goggles glow in the dark. I honestly doubt they’d put snow camo on anything. I think they’d even go so far as to avoid using combine elite anywhere but indoors.

They had forest camo on the soldiers in EP2.

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Discussion and Information.
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
Minimum what? And honestly, why should anyone, let alone Valve, shoot for a minimum standard?

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Discussion and Information.
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
If they’re really going for a snowy environment for Ep. 3 then they better use the Uncharted 2 snow levels as the minimum standard they should shoot for.

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Discussion and Information.
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
Saying “Zombine-torsos” would have made that clearer.

Garfuncle:

Would like to see the return of cut Beta enemies. More Synths like the Combine Super Soldier.

Why? you barely know anything about them besides the way they look. And what we do know isn’t anything that spectacular.

GFreeman515:

You might only see Snow-Camo Striders,maybe a Half-Zombine

Putting camo on something that tall would be rather pointless. Might as well make it sky-colored. Not to mention the fact that Valve clearly avoid putting real camo on anything. They made the soldiers in HL1 use white camo so they’d stand out in the desert & combine goggles glow in the dark. I honestly doubt they’d put snow camo on anything. I think they’d even go so far as to avoid using combine elite anywhere but indoors.

Read full topic
